Title:
Gesasha (Halosphaeriales, Ascomycota), a new genus with three
new species from mangroves in Japan
Keywords:
Aniptodera . Halosarpheia . marine fungi . phylogenetics .
subtropical
Abstract:
A new genus, Gesasha Abdel-Wahab & Nagahama, with
three new species were recorded from Gesashi mangroves, Okinawa, Japan.
Molecular phylogenetic analyses of the partial SSU and LSU rDNA placed
the three new species into a distant diverged clade with a highly
statistical support in the Halosphaeriales, Ascomycota. The new genus is
characteriazed by hyaline to dark brown immersed to erumpent coriaceous
ascomata, persistent asci with apical thickening, pore and cytoplasmic
retraction below the ascus apex and unicellular or bi-celled ascospore
with or without ephemeral, amorphous polar appendages.
